intro: Aiouea guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan aiouea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other aromatic plants such as eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
